# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

Here is how you can solve this problem in Julia:

```julia
using Dates

function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime; bump = 3)
    if typeof(dt) == DateTime
        return dt + Hour(bump)
    elseif typeof(dt) == Date
        throw(ArgumentError("The function should only work with DateTime types. A Date type was provided."))
    end
end
```
This function `timezone_bumper` takes a date and time object as an argument (`dt`) and adds the number of hours defined by the parameter `bump`. If the argument is not a DateTime, it throws an error with a custom message.
